node.title: Son of famed author charged in overdose death of baby daughter
node.description: The medical examiner's office found the cause of death to be "acute intoxication by the combined effects of fentanyl and heroin," the police said.

node.title: Body of young boy found by mushroom hunter in Indiana woods
node.description: Investigators believe the child's death occurred sometime within the last week.

node.title: Congress seeks compromise to boost computer chip industry
node.description: President Biden will need support from 10 Senate Republicans to get a bill to his desk.

node.title: Nearly half of Americans feel they pay too much in taxes
node.description: Most expect a refund this year, but few will be spending it on something fun or special.

node.title: How to watch the Lyrid meteor shower peak on Earth Day
node.description: Look up! Shooting stars are arriving as we celebrate our planet.

node.title: 2 minors killed in shooting at Pittsburgh party, police say
node.description: Pittsburgh police said in a news release that the shooting happened at about 12:30 a.m. during a party at a short-term rental property.

node.title: Japan investing in stem cells to cope with world's oldest population
node.description: Japan is trying to carve a niche in "regenerative medicine" by culturing healthy cells to replace diseased, injured or non-functioning ones.

node.title: Japan investing in stem cells to help cope with world's oldest population
node.description: Japan is trying to carve a niche in "regenerative medicine" by culturing healthy cells to replace diseased, injured or non-functioning ones.

node.title: Ukraine says 7 people dead in "powerful" attack on western city of Lviv
node.description: "While the major build-up of Russian forces continues in the east of Ukraine, the whole of the country continues to be at risk," official says.

node.title: Critical race theory mentions lead Florida to ban many math textbooks
node.description: State education officials found that 41 percent of the books submitted violated its standards. That's the most in the state's history.

node.title: Woman's body found stuffed inside duffle bag in New York City
node.description: Neighbors said Orsolya Gaal lived in the home with her two sons, ages 13 and 17, and her husband.

node.title: Ukraine says 6 people dead in "powerful" attack on western city of Lviv
node.description: "While the major build-up of Russian forces continues in the east of Ukraine, the whole of the country continues to be at risk," official says.

node.title: Georgia man accused of killing grandmother by stuffing her in freezer
node.description: "He said she was the only family member that gave him the courtesy and love and attention he needed," authorities said.

node.title: Man convicted 4 years after Utah teens found dead in mine shaft
node.description: The bodies of Brelynne "Breezy" Otteson and Riley Powell were found 100 feet down an abandoned mine shaft.

node.title: Alex Jones' Infowars files for bankruptcy
node.description: Jones was found liable in at least two defamation suits over his assertions that the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting was a hoax.

node.title: Departing Labour MP Louisa Wall: 'This was not entirely my choice'
node.description: The long-serving MP Louisa Wall has fired a broadside at her own Labour Party as she leaves Parliament - using her valedictory speech to accuse the party president of leading a corrupt process. Video

node.title: China's economic activity in March heightens risks to outlook
node.description: China's economic activity slowed in March, with weakness in consumption, property and exports eclipsing faster-than-expected first quarter GDP growth, suggesting a worsening in the outlook.

node.title: US investors turn to defensive stocks
node.description: US stock investors worried geopolitical uncertainty and inflation could dent economic growth are heading for defensive sectors they believe can better weather turbulent times.

node.title: Woman learning to drives in cemetery knocks over headstones
node.description: Police say eeight were flattened but crews got all eight back upright.

node.title: Digital clutter: The benefits of a digital 'spring clean'
node.description: Digital clutter is 'overloading our brains' but there are ways to take back control.

node.title: Pandemic nudges New Zealanders to give more and make wills
node.description: New Zealanders have upped their generosity during the pandemic, a new survey shows.

node.title: Thunderstorms, heavy rain prompt safety warning to holidaymakers on roads
node.description: Holidaymakers heading home from Northland after the Easter break are facing treacherous conditions on the roads.

node.title: Suspicious item at Boston airport turns out to be a PlayStation
node.description: Police said the suspicious device was a PlayStation console in "a degraded condition."

node.title: Covid-19 update: 6242 new community cases, 11 deaths
node.description: Another 11 people have died from Covid-19, and 6242 more community cases have been detected, health authorities say.

node.title: Sri Lanka's reluctance to tap IMF pushed it into an economic abyss
node.description: Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis has triggered a wave of protests as the island nation of 22 million struggles with power cuts and a shortage of essentials.

node.title: Man awarded $450,000 after company birthday party he didn't want
node.description: Kevin Berling asked his company not to have the party because it would stress him out but it did, anyway. Then he suffered two panic attacks and got fired.

node.title: Unrest in Sweden over planned Qur'an burnings
node.description: Clashes have taken place for a fourth day in several Swedish cities, sparked by the apparent burning of a Qur'an by a far-right, anti-immigrant group.

node.title: Easter 2022 in photos from around the world
node.description: Take a look at Easter weekend through the lens of photographers around the world.

node.title: One of Nelson's oldest commercial waterfront buildings up for sale
node.description: Nelson City Council is looking to sell or lease the Anchor Shipping & Foundry Co building on Wakefield Quay.

node.title: Ukraine war: Mariupol defenders will fight to the end - PM
node.description: Ukrainian defenders of the besieged port of Mariupol will fight to the end against Russian forces, the country's prime minister says.
